metadata.Title: CVE-2018-14721 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
FasterXML jackson-databind 2.x before 2.9.7 might allow remote attackers to conduct server-side request forgery (SSRF) attacks by leveraging failure to block the axis2-jaxws class from polymorphic deserialization. It was discovered that Jackson Databind incorrectly handled deserialization. An attacker could possibly use this issue to execute server-side request forgery (SSRF).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-14721` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjackson2-databind-java - 2.9.7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: jackson-databind package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.9.7').
